name: SOLN
description:
SOLN is a Simplistic Shooter Game in which your goal is to eliminate the fabricated star singularity.

This game is a PROTOTYPE, which means it is unfinished and no audio. Particles are disabled on the web version due to rendering issues.

Controls:

  • Mouse to Move
  • Click to Execute Command
  • Space to Change Commands

Commands:

  • Attack: Shoots towards the singularity.
  • Protect: Forms arificial purple ships that fly towards your cursor after a delay.
  • Orbit: Forms green orbs that orbits the greatest mass it is near. Staying near the orbits causes them to linger longer and closer, eventually diminishing enough to be pulled into the singularity.
  • Scan: Blue lines scan and damage any enemy it touches around the player until it eventually locks on a calculated direction for 1.5s.
  • Destruct: Creates a fast red artificial supernova that instantly kills enemies.

Singularity Events

  • Escaping ships: Enemy ships "escape" the pull of the infinite mass of the singularity, and are directed to the cursor. Ships vary in 3 different speed levels.
  • Bullets: Random bullets you fired are shot back to random or directed locations.
  • Beams: Random rotating bursts of energy are emitted from the singularity.

Overtime, the difficulty exponential increases with some unavoidable issues.  You only have 8 health, while the singularity has 500. Damage from the different commands vary.

The name "SOLN" refers to "SOL" which is star and "N" relating to the singularity. Moreover, it is a pun on the world "solved" that is denoted in the end game screen.
